name: Ca' Angeli

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent ages dithering over which hotel to book for our 3-day Venice trip, checking out all the Trip Advisor reports against the hotel websites. If you're having the same trouble – my advice would be to stop fretting and just book Ca'Angeli! It's spotlessly clean, very comfortable, the staff are wonderfully helpful and friendly, the location is in a quiet alley - yet just a minute’s walk from bustling shops and restaurants and only 10-minutes to the Rialto Bridge. The breakfast buffet was good quality and gave enough choices for everyone.
reviews.title: Just wonderful!

likes.liked: — Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, comfortable rooms. Location.

reviews.title: Loved the Ca'Angeli
reviews.text: We had Room 22, a double with a view of the terrace. It was very quiet (except for one cat fight!). The bedroom was a good size with a very comfortable bed, the bathroom was an odd shape, being long and thin, but was roomy enough, including a bath, separate shower and two sinks. There was also a large walk-in wardrobe so you can stash all your stuff away completely out of sight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: One of my party had a mild medical problem and the staff were incredibly helpful in advising us on seeing a doctor and fielding phone messages from our travel insurance company.
reviews.title: excellent stay

likes.disliked: — Can't think of any right now.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good location
reviews.text: I may have misunderstood one of the previous reviewer’s comments – but I don’t understand what the problem is with the hotel staff coming into the room to close the window shutters in the evening. The room is accessed during the day for cleaning so I’m not sure what the difference is. There is a safe available in the room if you’re worried about valuables. Also the shutters shut out any extra light and noise and provided good privacy, and can be easily opened yourself in the morning when you want to check the weather!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent a week at Ca'Angeli in May 2007. The hotel is in a superb situtation overlooking the Grand Canal making it very convenient for the vaporetta routes. The location was also good for small shops and cafes and for exploring the labyrinth of back streets and canals which are so much a part of a holiday in Venci. Our room was spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: great b&b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent place to stay at if you are fortunate enough to find a room so book way early or you may find only one of the more expensive rooms avaliable like we did which made the place that much more wonderful. Venice is LaLa land and like disneyland almost unreal, too touristic, and and outrageously expensive. You will spend more for food to dine out then other places in Italy so budget accordingly if you want to dine well, take that mandatory gondala ride (around 90 eoros) and have that frightfully expensive but necessary beverage at a cafe in St. Marks square watching the pigeons do you know what to the tourist. Make sure you map out and have you ducks in order as to how to get to this charming place once you disembark off of the water Taxi at Silvestri stop on the Grand Canal. It is a maze in the beginning , especially if you are tired coming off of a train or plane , but you do get used to it. Also, for those who plan to leave Venice by train and it is still tourist season which unbelievably runs throught late october, do book passage out on the Eurostar train (the Fast one) a head of time, otherwise, you may have to take the local. The staff are so helpful ,and the view in the sitting room overlooking the Grand Canal so delightful, and the breadfast is more than adequate-so what can I say , you are so lucky to stumble on to this place and be fortunate enough to stay there. This opinion is from someone who also stays at five star properties. There is this famous bridge called the Rialto (I hope my spelling is correct) and the Rialto bridge is one of a handful that cross the Grand Canal. Once you cross the Rialto which is a short walk from the Bed and breadfast, and you must do so to get to St. Marks, the world and atmosphere changes and there are more tourist and congestion. In other words, you will appreciate going over the Rialto on your way back leaving and getting away from all that hustle and congestion and consider yourself so fortunate with the location of this bed and breadfast. When you leave this property and immediately get on the main drag make a left (away from the direction of the Rialto bridge ) if you want to explore the more authentic less touristic parts of Venice by foot. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Fantastic, the reviews are more than correct!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its hard to find things that have not already been said, this place is a quiet haven away from all the hussle & bussle of the city.
reviews.title: 5 star views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everywhere is spotless and clean, the breakfast is really lovely with attention to detail, you just have to try everything !
reviews.title: A Place for Romance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: As this property is on the third floor the lift comes in very handy.
reviews.title: Beautiful - Wonderful!

likes.liked: — Quaint, small inn - peaceful, tucked away, but near everything.

reviews.title: idyllic
reviews.text: Our room did not have a view but the lounge/library had the most stunning views over the Grand Canal, something we will never forget on our first morning as we had arrived late evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Ca' Angeli in Venice, with its wonderful views overlooking the Grand Canal, was the perfect place to spend 5 days in August. The location was excellent for tourist shops, cafes, restaurants and gelaterias, being just a minute away and yet it offered peace and tranquility after a hectic day of sight-seeing.
reviews.title: A memorable holiday

likes.liked: — The breakfast and views of the Grand Canal from the communcal lounge
likes.disliked: — Lack of views from bedrooms and poor quality TV and reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (my husband and two daughters aged 10 and 16) had reserved the apartment located in the roof. This offered plenty of room but the windows were small and at high level and no views were available. We had been informed of this and the views from the communal lounge with its window seats more than made up for this. The apartment was spotless and the decor was somewhat dark. There was a nicely fitted bathroom with plenty of towels and toiletries. Though there was a strict rule about having no food or drinks of ones own, there were excellent places to eat close by.
reviews.title: Great digs
Ca' Angeli superb
reviews.text: The small breakfast room adjacent to the communcal lounge with its antique furniture, was very pleasant with Vivaldi and other classical music playing quietly in the background; the continental breakfast was the best I've ever had with the freshest food of the highest quality being served. I cannot stress how good this was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were helpful and when we left we were presented with local biscuits and sweets for the girls.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is definitely a hotel I would recommend to friends
reviews.title: Spectacular

likes.liked: — small home like feeling in a beautiful location

reviews.title: Magnifico!
reviews.text: We stayed four nights in Room 5 which had a very large terrace with a partial view of the Grand Canal. All of the amenities in the room were lovely, except the room was rather small. The terrace was larger than the room. That being said, we were still comfortable. When we return to Venice we will request one of the larger rooms with a larger bath. We really enjoyed the hotel and its services and the location was fabulous. Everyone was gracious and most helpful. Close to the Rialto Bridge and a short distance to San Marco Square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was wonderful at Ca Angeli. The location on the Grand Canal is magical. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Get directions other than the website map

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and nicely furnished.
reviews.title: IFabulous - Ideally Located on Grand Canall

likes.liked: — The view onto the Grand Canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we ever visit Venice, we would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a little tricky to locate, but half of the fun in Venice
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after reading all of the reviews online; we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Venice Hotel

likes.liked: — view from the day room of the grand canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only complaint i can come up with is that this place is hard to find, even after downloading their map-you will get lost, believe me. However, after finally finding the place, you'll be happy.
reviews.title: Awesome end to a wonderful honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was very nice, spotless, relatively large. We had no view, but in the day room there is a great view, with 2 window seats available; my wife and i sat there each night with a glass of wine(or two...) and watched the action on the grand canal; probably our fondest memory of our entire italy trip.
reviews.title: Book this place if you can...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel is owned by 2 brothers; very nice, answered all our questions, made dinner recommendations, etc.
reviews.title: A Perfect Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great breakfast.
reviews.title: One of the best Hotels we have stayed at in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the junior suite with whirlpool bath, which has windows opening onto Central Canal. We were awoken with the chijmes of distant churches and an opera singer on a godula below our window. It was simply magical! The hotel is in a fantastic area down a quite little alley. The courtyard at night is lit by candles and the hotel is decced in magnificent antiques. It is exactly how I imagined staying in Venice would be!
reviews.title: Priceless View!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much research we selected this great B & B in Venice.
reviews.title: Wonderfull jewel in Venice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007
reviews.text: From our arrival to departure we felt like a 4 star hotel. The rooms were immaculate and newly decorated with venician chandeliers from Murano and lovely furnishings. The room bar and safe were welcome. Breakfast could not have been topped.
reviews.title: A Pearl in the Adriatic

likes.liked: — The friendly and attentive staff. Great location and safe atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The professional staff made us feel welcome 24 hours a day.
reviews.title: Fantastic all the way around, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The library looks out to the stunning grande canal with changing scenery avery minute. The location near the Realto Bridge is central and surrounded by great restaurants and shops. The staff made excellent recommandations as far as eating and sightseeing is concerned. Don`t miss this gem. We had a great time there and will return and stay at Ca Angeli many more times.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a 2-night stay at Ca'Angeli based solely on the TripAdvisor reviews, and my experience there matches what others before me have written. They don't have a TripAdvisor award on their mantle for nothing! I only hope that I will be able to get a room there in the future as the popularity of the inn will continue to grow! The location is great, right on Grand Canal, but finding it can be a little challenging if you are new to Venice and forgot to bring the directions (like I did..) but nonetheless it is very easy once you find it. That particular area of Venice will offer everything you need as a tourist, and is a great springboard to see both the main attractions or to just get lost in less traveled areas that have equally as much to discover. For the inn, our room was large, clean, comfortable, and quiet. There were some Venetian artifacts on the walls which gave it even more appeal. The breakfasts were great, the staff was very helpful with local information and even prepared an early taxi departure for us to the airport. We had a 6AM departure, and my lasting memory was the terrific breakfast they packed us for the road. Venice was the highlight of our trip thanks to Ca'Angeli.
reviews.title: Don't hesitate - Get it done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our room was a junior suite overlooking the Grand Canal. My fondest memory is waking up to the church bells ringing. Both the bedroom and bathroom were large and clean. They have a picture of the suite on their website. The staff was very accommodating, with suggestions on what to see and where to eat. The breakfast was one of the best we had in Italy. We looked forward each morning to the chocolate crossiants and freshly squeezed orange juice. They also had cereal, pastries, meats, hard boiled eggs, coffee, etc. On the day we checked out, Ambra (front desk) gave us a box of cookies for our train ride to Florence. We enjoyed our stay here very much. It is well located near the San Silvestro stop (close to Rialto Bridge). The area is quiet, which we appreciated after spending the day with a thousand of our closest friends. They also have a common area that overlooks the Grand Canal. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Memorable
Ca' Angelia was wonderful
reviews.text: We visited Venice on the last weekend in May, when both the vogalonga (or "long row") and the Regatta of the Ancient Italian maritime republics were being held. Watching the hundreds of rowing boats manoeuvre along the narrow canal in Cannaregio was a wonderful experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Directions provided by the hotel were spot on and we found it easily., despite arriving quite late at night.
reviews.title: Just book it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Staff were always friendly, welcoming and helpful.
reviews.title: Charming!

likes.liked: — The lovely common room overlooking the Grand Canal, and the elegant/delicious breakfast that was served there each morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Ca' Angeli. After a grueling trip, we arrived very late in the evening and were graciously greeted and given advice on where to get something to eat. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal. We kept the window open and loved watching the boat traffic. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices. We had to leave very early in the morning to catch a train and they even provided a 'bag breakfast'. Ambra was especially helpful in providing restaurant recommendations, making reservations and giving us suggestions on touring destinations. We stayed at several B&Bs in Italy and this was was by far the best experience.
reviews.title: Loved the view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fab place - breakfast amazing and good facilities. staff very helpful. would recommend it to any one going to Venice
reviews.title: we loved this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a bit sceptical about Venice as a destination as its main function is to be a tourist destination which means that most people are either tourists or locals making money out of tourists. Consequently I had lower expectations when it came to good accommodation in Venice.
reviews.title: Perfect Place in Venice

likes.disliked: — Smell of cat pee at the front gate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ca' Angeli looked terrific on the internet. Once we found the place which was a bit tricky, it was clear that this was something special. It was a real delight to come to. It has been recently renovated but had retained its traditional Venetian style. The staff spoke quite good English and were very helpful. Our room was great and the bathroom was impressively large with a bidet, the only one we came across on our European trip.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — Room was hot due to unseasonably warm weather, heat couldn't be switched over to air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is good by Italian standards because even though I love Italian food, breakfasts always seem to be the forgotten meal.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

likes.disliked: — We didn't have a view of the canal - but those rooms were booked out & we knew that!

description: During the last century, this house belonged to Angelo Scattolin, a famous Venetian architect, Chair in Architecture at the University of Venice, professor at the Academy of Fine Arts and Overseer of St. Mark's Church between the 1960s and 70s.In his house, he blended the classic Venetian styles with solutions which were already paving the way for modern architecture: respect for tradition and innovation are combined with a simple, rational style in the rooms and furnishings, reflecting the light and charm of Venice.
